title: Welcome to My Portfolio
text:
Hello, I’m Raj!
Hi! I am Suyamprakasam Varadaraj. You can call me Varun or Raj.
I am currently pursuing an undergraduate program in Applied Artificial Intelligence (BSc Honours) at Singapore Institute of Technology.
I am especially enthusiastic about the transformative potential of artificial intelligence and its ability to revolutionize different industries. My objective is to harness the power of AI to drive meaningful change and create significant improvements for both communities and organizations.
I am known for my confident and proactive approach, which allows me to lead with both clarity and effectiveness. This approach enables me to navigate complex situations and drive initiatives forward with precision. My leadership style involves not only guiding teams but also inspiring and motivating individuals to reach their full potential. I bring critical thinking and strong communication skills to the table, complemented by an open-minded attitude, a hardworking ethic, and a positive approach to learning. These qualities help me tackle challenges effectively and foster a collaborative and engaged environment.

title: Welcome to My Portfolio
text:
My Interests

Sports
I am passionate about sports and use them to maintain a healthy lifestyle. I particularly enjoy running and playing ball sports, with a special fondness for football. My sports background includes being part of the track and field team at Singapore Polytechnic, where I also served as president of the long-distance team. Additionally, I was the vice-captain for cricket at Ping Yi Secondary School and currently captain my own football team formed with friends. I love exploring new sports and am currently part of the Singapore Institute of Technology football varsity team.


Photography
I recently discovered a passion for photography, which I’ve come to truly enjoy. It offers me a fresh perspective and the unique ability to freeze moments in time, allowing me to capture memories that will accompany me through life. I particularly enjoy taking portraits and photographing architecture. I’m also eager to explore videography in the future!


Traveling
I enjoy traveling because it gives me the chance to engage with different cultures and experiences. Every trip offers new experiences and opportunities that deepen my awareness of various lifestyles. Traveling allows me to make lifelong connections and to connect with people from all walks of life.

title: My Projects
text:
This is an embedded <a target="_blank" href="https://office.com">Microsoft Office</a> presentation, powered by <a target="_blank" href="https://office.com/webapps">Office</a>.

The team built an NLP model to distinguish positive and negative tweets from an open-source Twitter dataset. The project involved:

Exploratory Data Analysis to understand the dataset

Feature Engineering to generate valuable features

Modeling using SVM & Random Forest classifiers

Hyperparameter Tuning via grid search

Integration of VADER sentiment scoring, offset multiplier fusion, and custom rule-based random forest models to improve accuracy

These enhancements led to the selection of the best-performing model by the end of the notebook, with meaningful improvements in sentiment classification accuracy.

title: My Projects
text:
Game Engine: Spell & Seek

This is an embedded <a target="_blank" href="https://office.com">Microsoft Office</a> presentation, powered by <a target="_blank" href="https://office.com/webapps">Office</a>.

This project showcases Spell & Seek, an educational Java game built on the abstract game engine created in Phase 1. Designed to encourage early language development in children, it promotes:

Spelling and word recognition through maze navigation
Cognitive growth via spatial-word association
Audio support that vocalizes target words to enhance listening and pronunciation

The system emphasizes sound software architecture, using SOLID principles and design patterns like Factory and Observer, while maintaining a clean separation between engine logic and game functionality.

title: My Projects
text:
Abstract Game Engine

This is an embedded <a target="_blank" href="https://office.com">Microsoft Office</a> presentation, powered by <a target="_blank" href="https://office.com/webapps">Office</a>.

We developed a modular abstract engine that serves as a solid foundation for future games. It demonstrates core OOP principles:

Encapsulation
Inheritance
Polymorphism
Abstraction

Using a manager-based architecture, each subsystem (e.g., rendering, input, logic) is independently extendable. While areas like dynamic level generation could be enhanced, the engine is well-suited for scalable game development.

title: My Projects
text:
Job Market Analysis



Jobs


Our team created a software platform to explore current job trends and predict outcomes in the employment landscape. Key features:

Interactive dashboard for analyzing demand, qualifications, and salary trends
Predictive salary model based on experience, age, and job type
Job recommendation engine using classification algorithms based on user input (e.g., experience, gender, education, expected salary)

This tool provides career insights for individuals and strategic data for organizations looking to understand or forecast workforce dynamics.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
In completing this assessment, I extensively utilized Generative AI (GenAI) tools — primarily ChatGPT by OpenAI. I chose this tool because of its advanced natural language capabilities, accessibility, and ease of integration with my workflow. ChatGPT is known for providing structured and articulate responses across a wide range of domains, including programming, writing, and research.


How GenAI Helped Me
GenAI was incredibly useful in various stages of this project:

Idea Structuring: I used ChatGPT to help outline the content for multiple sections, including my project descriptions and skills breakdown.
Markdown and Quarto Assistance: When formatting pages like index.qmd, projects.qmd, and skills.qmd, ChatGPT guided me on proper syntax and provided ready-to-use code blocks.
CSS Support: Helped me enhance the visual design of my portfolio by improving layout, typography, spacing, and overall consistency—making the site look more polished and professional.
Embedding Tips: When I needed to embed PowerPoint slides, ChatGPT suggested using Google Slides and OneDrive methods via iframe, which was extremely helpful.




Benefits of Using GenAI

Time Efficiency: It helped me avoid spending excessive time on technical troubleshooting or blank-page syndrome.
Idea Expansion: Sometimes I started with a rough idea, and ChatGPT expanded it into well-structured content.
Coding Aid: When I was unsure about certain HTML/Markdown structures or Quarto configs, GenAI assisted with the syntax.




Challenges I Encountered

Over-Reliance Risk: It’s easy to depend too much on GenAI suggestions without critical evaluation.
Generic Responses: Occasionally, the responses lacked depth or originality, especially in more creative or reflective tasks.
Formatting Adjustments: Although the tool suggested Markdown/HTML snippets, some fine-tuning was needed to fit the Quarto environment exactly.




Looking Ahead
I believe GenAI tools like ChatGPT will continue to play a crucial role in my academic and professional journey. In future:

For Study: I can use it to understand complex topics, generate practice questions, and get help with assignments.
For Work: It can help in writing reports, automating documentation, generating code, and even assisting in communication tasks.




Final Thoughts
Using GenAI has been a highly enriching experience. While it’s important to apply personal judgment and creativity, I see these tools as powerful collaborators — especially when used ethically and responsibly. They can boost productivity, expand thinking, and make digital creation more accessible for everyone.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
In completing this assessment, I extensively utilized Generative AI (GenAI) tools — primarily ChatGPT by OpenAI. I chose this tool because of its advanced natural language capabilities, accessibility, and ease of integration with my workflow. ChatGPT is known for providing structured and articulate responses across a wide range of domains, including programming, writing, and research.



GenAI was incredibly useful in various stages of this project:

Idea Structuring: I used ChatGPT to help outline the content for multiple sections, including my project descriptions and skills breakdown.
Markdown and Quarto Assistance: When formatting pages like index.qmd, projects.qmd, and skills.qmd, ChatGPT guided me on proper syntax and provided ready-to-use code blocks.
Writing Support: It assisted me in improving the tone, grammar, and clarity of my writing, making the portfolio sound more polished and professional.
Embedding Tips: When I needed to embed PowerPoint slides, ChatGPT suggested using Google Slides and OneDrive methods via iframe, which was extremely helpful.






Time Efficiency: It helped me avoid spending excessive time on technical troubleshooting or blank-page syndrome.
Idea Expansion: Sometimes I started with a rough idea, and ChatGPT expanded it into well-structured content.
Coding Aid: When I was unsure about certain HTML/Markdown structures or Quarto configs, GenAI acted like an instant tutor.






Over-Reliance Risk: It’s easy to depend too much on GenAI suggestions without critical evaluation.
Generic Responses: Occasionally, the responses lacked depth or originality, especially in more creative or reflective tasks.
Formatting Adjustments: Although the tool suggested Markdown/HTML snippets, some fine-tuning was needed to fit the Quarto environment exactly.





I believe GenAI tools like ChatGPT will continue to play a crucial role in my academic and professional journey. In future:

For Study: I can use it to understand complex topics, generate practice questions, and get help with assignments.
For Work: It can help in writing reports, automating documentation, generating code, and even assisting in communication tasks.





Using GenAI has been a highly enriching experience. While it’s important to apply personal judgment and creativity, I see these tools as powerful collaborators — especially when used ethically and responsibly. They can boost productivity, expand thinking, and make digital creation more accessible for everyone.

title: Hackathons
text:
Interpersonal


I’m currently participating in the National AI Student Challenge (NAISC), organized by AI Singapore, with support from IMDA and other partners.
This initiative has engaged over 2,000 students and aims to:

Empower youth with practical AI knowledge
Provide real-world exposure through hands-on challenges
Foster innovation and creative problem-solving
Nurture the next generation of AI users, practitioners, and creators

Through this challenge, I’m gaining valuable experience working on real-world AI problems, collaborating with like-minded peers, and exploring impactful use cases for AI in industry and society.

title: Hackathons
text:
SCDF Hackathon



SCDF


I’m also taking part in the SCDF Hackathon, a national-level innovation challenge focused on emergency response, public safety, and urban resilience.
This hackathon provides a platform to:

Develop tech-driven solutions to enhance Singapore’s emergency services
Collaborate with domain experts from the Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF)
Apply design thinking, GenAI, and data-driven strategies to critical real-world problems
Present innovative solutions that could potentially be adopted by SCDF or its partners

Participating in both hackathons is helping me sharpen my technical, teamwork, and critical thinking skills — all while contributing toward meaningful public good.

Stay tuned for project updates and results!
